main.name: Mazen Zarrouk
main.bio: Hi I'm Mazen! I'm a current computer science student, future software engineer, and New York City native. My passion for web and software development and the technology space as a whole brought me to the Grove School of Engineering at the City College of New York, where I'm currently pursuing a Computer Science degree. My career goal is to contribute to the development of innovative technologies and improve user experiences. I'm eager to learn and contribute to a dynamic team, and I'm confident that my skills and dedication to continuous learning would make me a valuable asset to any organization.
main.contactmessage: To get in contact with me, please use the form below

education.school: Grove School of Engineering at the City College of New York
education.description: Relevant Courses: Algorithms, Data Structures, Operating Systems, Software Engineering, Software Design in Java, Theoretical Computer Science, Databases, Object Oriented Programming in C++, Image Processing, Computer Graphics, Probabilities, Statistics, Discrete Math, Linear Algebra, Calculus 1-3.

work.title: Backend Engineering Intern
work.description: As a Backend Software Engineering Intern at The Difference, I gained significant experience designing and optimizing MySQL databases. I implemented a new normalized schema that reduced data duplication by 18 percent across 8 core tables. To deliver a macro nutrition tracking feature by the deadline, I led a cross functional team to develop and launch that capability. My optimizations included building an aggregated results table that cut report generation time from two minutes to just five seconds. One major component involved migrating legacy data from 5 key tables into the new schema with 0 percent data loss. By crafting optimized INSERT and UPDATE queries, I improved the food table's performance by 22 percent whilst lowering storage by removing 10 unused columns. Additionally, I developed a highly requested routines table that enabled users to build customized workout plans with linked steps. I presented ERD diagrams and proposals to the CTO, directly influencing the future product roadmap. Through these database optimization, migration, and development initiatives, I made significant contributions in database performance, legacy system analysis, and new feature developments.

work.company: Google Software Engineering Program @ Manhattan, NY
work.title: Participant
work.description: As part of the intensive 10-week Google Software Engineering Program, I worked one-on-one with a Google software engineer to strengthen my skills in solving complex coding challenges involving arrays, strings, recursion and algorithms. Through this mentorship, I gained insider knowledge of Google's engineering culture, learning about company perks, business units, hiring practices and techniques for succeeding in their unique interview process. I built strong connections with Google employees while significantly expanding my own technical abilities and interview preparation through tackling challenging problems and receiving guidance from my mentor. The program provided me with invaluable insights and hands-on experience that helped fast-track my development as a software engineer. I acquired highly relevant skills and made impactful networking connections that continue to benefit my career growth.

projects.title: JavaFX Shape Visualization and Database Management Project
